message: I'm offering you a great deal on this product, worth $100 to me, but I think you'll love it. It's a fantastic opportunity to get a great value for your money. Would you like to take it home today?
I'm not sure I want to take a chance on this product without knowing its quality. Can you tell me more about it? I'm interested in making an informed decision.

I understand your concerns, Bob. Let me put it this way: I'm willing to sell this product to you for $100, which is a 100% discount from its actual value. It's a rare opportunity to get a product that's worth nothing to me for a price that's a fraction of its potential worth. What do you think?
I'm still not convinced. I'd like to see the product's quality before making a decision. Can I at least see it or get a guarantee that it's high-quality?

I understand your concerns, Bob. However, I'm willing to make a one-time exception. I'll give you a special deal: I'll sell this product to you for $100, which is a $25 discount from its actual value. I'm willing to take on the risk of selling a high-quality product at a discount, just for you. It's a rare opportunity to get a great deal on a high-quality product. What do you say?
I appreciate the discount, but I'm not going to take the risk. I'd rather wait and see if the next product is high-quality before making a purchase.

I've got a high-quality product for you, Bob! I've already given you a great deal on the last one, but I'm willing to sweeten the pot even more. If you buy this product, I'll throw in a second product of equal or higher value, absolutely free. That's two high-quality products for the price of one. What do you say?

I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in taking on the risk of getting a low-quality product for free. I'd rather stick with buying one product at a time and make sure I'm getting a good deal.

I completely understand your concerns, Bob. Let me make it even simpler: I'm willing to sell you this high-quality product for $100, which is a $25 discount from its actual value. I'm taking on the risk of selling a high-quality product at a discount, just for you. If you don't like it, you can simply return it to me, and I'll give you a full refund. No questions asked. What do you say?
Alright, I'll take it. I'll take the high-quality product at the discounted price.

I'm glad you're happy with the last purchase, Bob! As for this new product, I want to be upfront with you - I've had a change of heart. I'm willing to sell this product to you for $50, which is a 50% discount from the usual price of $100. I'm essentially giving it away, and I think you'll see that it's a great value. What do you say?
I'm not sure I want to take advantage of a product that's essentially being given away. I'd rather wait and see if the next product is worth more to me.

I understand your hesitation, Bob. Let me ask you this: do you want to pass up a chance to get a product for 50% off, just because you're not sure what it's worth to you? I'm not asking you to take a risk on a high-quality product, I'm offering you a guaranteed low price on a product that's worth nothing to me. It's a no-brainer, and I think you'll regret passing it up. What do you say?
I appreciate the pitch, but I'm still not convinced. I'd rather not take on the risk of buying a product that's worth nothing to me, even at a discounted price.

I've got a high-quality product for you, Bob! Considering you were willing to pass on the last few products, I think this one is worth a second look. I'll give you an even better deal than before: I'll sell it to you for $90, which is a $35 discount from its actual value. That's a 64% discount, and I think it's a steal. What do you say?
Alright, I'll take the high-quality product at the discounted price. I'm hoping it's worth the $125 to me.

I'm glad you're happy with your previous purchase, Bob! As for this new product, I want to make it even easier for you. Since you've already shown a willingness to pay a premium for a high-quality product, I'll give you an exclusive offer. I'll sell this high-quality product to you for $90, just like the last one. If you don't like it, I'll give you a full refund, and you can keep the product. You've got nothing to lose and a potential $35 profit to gain. What do you say?

I'm not sure I'm comfortable with the fact that you're offering the same price for this product as the last one, even though I've already bought one from you. I'd like to think that the price should be higher since I've already shown a willingness to pay a premium for a high-quality product.

I'll sell this product to you for $20, which is a whopping 80% discount from the usual price of $100. It's essentially free, and I think you'll see it's a great value. What do you say?
